text: Kentucky is a land of contrasts from the
sleek beauty of the race horses to the
stark poverty of the rural landscape
it's the worst of the USA's 50 states
for smoking and cancer not far from the
bottom for heart disease strokes and
premature death it's a sort of place
where Obamacare is meant to make a real
difference Banita Willingham hopes it
does because she's just had some bad
news the cancer is back and it's in my
bone marrow you know I gotta stay
focused I got a 21 year old daughter you
know and she's on edge about it but if
you do get greater cover how much
difference will that make to you I mean
that'll make a big difference that might
take a big load off of me Obama has
really did something great you know for
the United States you know I mean people
complain but nobody's ever going to be
totally sad is right but after a month
of asking nobody can tell her what he
will actually mean for her and that's
critical Obamacare is arguably the
biggest most important thing this
president has done it's certain to be
his legacy and the reason because it'll
have an impact on the finances and lives
of millions of Americans the question
for good or ill we're dead in the water
until you have your driver's license in
a library in the small town of Bedford
Christie heart ledge is running into a
few glitches as she tries to sign up
another customer obviously we've had
glitches as everyone has but we've
overcome them and we're moving along and
and in the past four weeks I have signed
up over a hundred people but it's a lot
better than the national scheme which
has been a shambles from the Democrat
governor is spending a billion dollars
to hugely expand the healthcare program
for the poorest most of these people
have never had health coverage in their
lives and look they get up every day and
roll the dice and pray they don't get
sick they know that they are one bad
diagnosis away from bankruptcy this is a
conservative state more than sixty
percent voted for Romney three
Republican friends told me their dislike
of Obamacare isn't just political it's
personal it hits them in the pocketbook
it means higher costs
means a bigger burden on a college
student that's already tens of thousand
dollars in student debt Scott pill and
is just the sort of person Obamacare is
designed to help he couldn't get any
insurance because of a benign cyst now
companies have to cover him he still
doesn't like it it's not affordable even
if you excluded me out of the equation
it's not affordable for my for my wife
and my three children when you add me
into the mix that just taxed me onto the
planet makes it more expensive but the
Obamacare sign up is looking good in the
state precisely because of its poverty
how it affects people in the long run
will be much more important mark mod√®le
